wikitext.*:
{{Stub}}

[[File:Parma Eldalamberon 7 page 29.png|thumb|''Battle of the North March'' by [[Tom Loback]].]]

'''Nebrachar''' was a place of [[Orcs]]<ref name=manuscripts>''[[A Secret Vice: Tolkien on Invented Languages]]'', Part III, "The Manuscripts", "[BODLEIAN TOLKIEN MS. 24 FOLIOS 50–2 RECTO:]"</ref> that appears in a [[Dir avosaith a gwaew hinar|poem]] written by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] that he used as an example of language invention in his lecture ''[[A Secret Vice]]''.<ref name=monsters>{{MC|6}}, pp. 217, 220 (note 11)</ref>

== Etymology ==
The meaning of ''Nebrachar'' is not known, but [[Dimitra Fimi]] and [[Andrew Higgins]] speculated in ''[[A Secret Vice: Tolkien on Invented Languages]]'' that the name might mean "near a place of slaughter" from the [[Noldorin]] roots ''[[NEB]]'' ("near")<ref>{{PE|13}}, p. 164</ref> and ''[[RHACH]]'' ("carnage, slaughter")<ref>{{PE|13}}, p. 152</ref>.<ref name=secret>''[[A Secret Vice: Tolkien on Invented Languages]]'', Part I, ''[[A Secret Vice]]'', "Notes", (note 81)</ref>
